domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: RT @CityofTreesMcr: Huge thank-you to @HelenSkelton for doing an amazing job presenting today‚Äôs @BBCCountryfile and for braving the element‚Ä¶
RT @Calderdale: The @EnvAgency Flood Warning is no longer in force at Hebble Brook at Halifax with the situation improving and no further f‚Ä¶
RT @LancashireCC: The brand new #Landscapes2Lifescapes digital exhibition can be found on the ‚ÄòLearning‚Äô page of #TheFloodHub. Check it out‚Ä¶

@katknight11 @KamRai7 @LCRA @BDParkRangers @EnvAgencySE @DarrenRodwell @RedbridgeLive @Jas_Athwal @katknight11 , it was cleared by the environment  agency, and it‚Äôs not been that bad.  I see the drinker about 8am sat on the mound and throwing the cans over.
@EarthlyIdeas @BurnhamDeepdale @alex_green84 @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke https://t.co/PPTAdc7AnM
RT @WaterSensors: A warm thanks to our outgoing Chairman of 2 years, Andrew Chappell @EnvAgency, and welcome to our new Chairman Oliver Gri‚Ä¶
@speedmicester @KamRai7 @LCRA @BDParkRangers @EnvAgencySE @DarrenRodwell @RedbridgeLive A lot of that rubbish has been there for years. This is @RedbridgeLive . @Jas_Athwal
@agricontract @EnvAgency Totally agree @agricontract  the issue needs to be addressed nationwide  it is cost effective to dredge the water ways surely instead of allowing areas to flood
@EnvAgencyNW  I think you need to look into what Tom  Pemberton and his dad are saying. https://t.co/CLn7lquBQK

entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

domain.name: TV Episodes
domain.description: Television show episodes

entity.name: Helen on Crompton Moor
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

urls.title: ‚ÄúFlood busting‚Äù leaky dams installed on Crompton Moor in Oldham - Natural Course
urls.description: New natural ‚Äòleaky dams‚Äô have been constructed on Crompton Moor, Oldham The dams are designed to slow the flow of water before it reaches towns and villages further downstream of the River Beal, including Shaw and Crompton The latest part of a project which uses natural methods to reduce flood risk in Oldham Innovative flood [‚Ä¶]
